page.title: 05PITSFORD SAILING CLUB
page.content: WITH A CURRENT MEMBERSHIP OF APPROXIMATELY 500, THE SAILING CLUB IS A THRIVING ORGANISATION WHICH WAS FORMED ALMOST AS SOON AS THE RESERVOIR WAS COMPLETED. IT PROVIDES SAILING AND RESCUE FACILITIES FROM EASTER UNTIL NOVEMBER AND BOATS ARE LAID-UP FOR THE WINTER MONTHS. THE CLUB DOES NOT ACTUALLY OWN ANY BOATS - THEY ARE ALL OWNED BY INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS. RACES ARE REGULARLY ORGANISED FOR THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF BOATS OVER A SET COURSE. PRIZES ARE AWARDED AT THE ANNUAL LAYING-UP DINNER IN NOVEMBER. TYPES OF BOATS USED ON THIS RESERVOIR INCLUDE GENERAL PURPOSE (14'),OPTIMIST (7'),ENTERPRISE (13'), FIREBALL (16'), THE 5 0 5 (16') AND THE FLYING FIFTEEN WHICH IS 20' OVERALL LENGTH BUT ONLY 15' AT THE WATER LINE - THIS BOAT IS RATHER EXPENSIVE BUT HAS A REPUTATION AS THE BEST PERFORMER IN ITS CLASS.
